intro: Salicornia arbuscula, commonly known as sea beans, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that often branch into clusters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, and it thrives in coastal areas, salt marshes, and estuaries. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Salicornia arbuscula is also valued for its edible stems, which are used in culinary applications in various cultures.
